alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 2:19PM EDT until April 01 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR EASTERN WARREN COUNTY... At 218 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Russell to Warren to Chapman State Park, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Warren, Sheffield, Youngsville, Russell, Scandia, Warren South, Kinzua Dam, Chapman State Park, Starbrick and Clarendon. This includes the following highways... Route 6 from Irvine to near Ludlow. Route 62 from north of Tidioute to the New York border. State Road 59 from Warren to east of Kinzua Dam. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across northwestern PA. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
